required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label, Two-Part, Phase 1/2a, Crossover Study to Determine the Absolute Bioavailability and Pharmacokinetics of Oral Immediate-Release Doses of OCR‑002 in Subjects With Varying Degrees of Cirrhosis

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open-label Phase 1/2a, 2-part, crossover study in approximately 33 adult subjects (12 subjects in Part 1 and 21 subjects in Part 2), with varying degrees of cirrhosis with analysis of PK data after Part 1 to guide dose regimen selection and PK sampling time points for OCR-002 in Part 2.

detailed_description.textblock:
Part 1, Phase 1: Dosing Periods 1, 2, 3, and 4:
Single-dose, partially randomized, 4-period crossover study to evaluate 5 g OCR-002 oral solution administered under fed conditions, fasting conditions, or under fasting conditions following discontinuation of lactulose in 12 subjects with cirrhosis (Child-Pugh class A and C).
The purpose is to determine the pharmacokinetics of PAA and PAGN following a single 5 g dose of OCR-002 oral solution administered under fed conditions, fasting conditions, or under fasting conditions following discontinuation of lactulose as compared to a single 5 g intravenous dose of OCR-002 under fasting conditions in subjects with cirrhosis (Child‑Pugh class A and C).
Analysis of pharmacokinetic data will be conducted after completion of Part 1 in order to determine the dose regimen of OCR-002 oral tablets to use in Part 2 of the study.
Part 2, Phase 2a: Dosing Periods 1, 2 and 3:
Multiple-dose, randomized, 3-period crossover study to evaluate OCR‑002 oral tablets in subjects with cirrhosis (Child-Pugh class B). The purpose is to characterize the PK and PD of OCR-002 tablets after TID administration for 5 days in subjects with cirrhosis (Child-Pugh class B).

primary_outcome.measure: Cmax of PAA and PAGN following a single 5 g dose of OCR-002 oral solution under fed or fasting conditions as compared to a single 5 g IV dose of OCR-002 under fasting conditions in participants with cirrhosis (Child-Pugh Classes A and C)
primary_outcome.description: Plasma concentrations of PAA, PAGN and ornithine will be analyzed by non-compartmental PK methods.

primary_outcome.measure: Tmax of PAA and PAGN following a single 5 g dose of OCR-002 oral solution under fed or fasting conditions as compared to a single 5 g IV dose of OCR-002 under fasting conditions in participants with cirrhosis (Child-Pugh Classes A and C)
primary_outcome.description: Plasma concentrations of PAA, PAGN and ornithine will be analyzed by non-compartmental PK methods.

primary_outcome.measure: AUC0-t of PAA and PAGN following a single 5 g dose of OCR-002 oral solution under fed or fasting conditions as compared to a single 5 g IV dose of OCR-002 under fasting conditions in participants with cirrhosis (Child-Pugh Classes A and C)
primary_outcome.description: Plasma concentrations of PAA, PAGN and ornithine will be analyzed by non-compartmental PK methods.

primary_outcome.measure: AUC0-24 of PAA and PAGN following a single 5 g dose of OCR-002 oral solution under fed or fasting conditions as compared to a single 5 g IV dose of OCR-002 under fasting conditions in participants with cirrhosis (Child-Pugh Classes A and C)
primary_outcome.description: Plasma concentrations of PAA, PAGN and ornithine will be analyzed by non-compartmental PK methods.

primary_outcome.measure: AUC0-36 of PAA and PAGN following a single 5 g dose of OCR-002 oral solution under fed or fasting conditions as compared to a single 5 g IV dose of OCR-002 under fasting conditions in participants with cirrhosis (Child-Pugh Classes A and C)
primary_outcome.description: Plasma concentrations of PAA, PAGN and ornithine will be analyzed by non-compartmental PK methods.

primary_outcome.measure: AUC0-inf of PAA and PAGN following a single 5 g dose of OCR-002 oral solution under fed or fasting conditions as compared to a single 5 g IV dose of OCR-002 under fasting conditions in participants with cirrhosis (Child-Pugh Classes A and C)
primary_outcome.description: Plasma concentrations of PAA, PAGN and ornithine will be analyzed by non-compartmental PK methods.

primary_outcome.measure: Half-life (t1/2) of PAA and PAGN following a single 5 g dose of OCR-002 oral solution under fed or fasting conditions as compared to a single 5 g IV dose of OCR-002 under fasting conditions in participants with cirrhosis (Child-Pugh Classes A and C)
primary_outcome.description: Plasma concentrations of PAA, PAGN and ornithine will be analyzed by non-compartmental PK methods.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the effect of a high-fat meal on the Cmax of 5 g OCR-002 oral solution in participants with cirrhosis (Child-Pugh Classes A and C)
primary_outcome.description: Participants will fast overnight for at least 8 hours prior to receiving the highfat (approximately 50% of total calorie content of the meal) and high-calorie (approximately 800 to 1000 calories) test meal, which will be entirely consumed within 30 minutes or less.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the effect of a high-fat meal on the AUC of 5 g OCR-002 oral solution in participants with cirrhosis (Child-Pugh Classes A and C)
primary_outcome.description: Participants will fast overnight for at least 8 hours prior to receiving the highfat (approximately 50% of total calorie content of the meal) and high-calorie (approximately 800 to 1000 calories) test meal, which will be entirely consumed within 30 minutes or less.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the effect of a high-fat meal on oral bioavailability of 5 g OCR-002 oral solution in participants with cirrhosis (Child-Pugh Classes A and C)
primary_outcome.description: Participants will fast overnight for at least 8 hours prior to receiving the highfat (approximately 50% of total calorie content of the meal) and high-calorie (approximately 800 to 1000 calories) test meal, which will be entirely consumed within 30 minutes or less.

primary_outcome.measure: Cmax of PAA and PAGN following a single dose of OCR-002 oral solution under fasting conditions in participants with cirrhosis who have discontinued lactulose (Child-Pugh Classes A and C)
primary_outcome.description: Cmax of PAA and PAGN following a single dose of OCR-002 oral solution under fasting conditions in participants with cirrhosis who have discontinued lactulose (Child-Pugh Classes A and C) will be determined.

primary_outcome.measure: AUC of PAA and PAGN following a single dose of OCR-002 oral solution under fasting conditions in participants with cirrhosis who have discontinued lactulose (Child-Pugh Classes A and C)
primary_outcome.description: AUC of PAA and PAGN following a single dose of OCR-002 oral solution under fasting conditions in participants with cirrhosis who have discontinued lactulose (Child-Pugh Classes A and C) will be determined.

primary_outcome.measure: Urinary excretion of PAGN following a single dose of each treatment in participants with cirrhosis (Child-Pugh Classes A and C)
primary_outcome.description: Urinary excretion profile of PAGN following a single dose of each treatment in participants with cirrhosis (Child-Pugh Classes A and C) will be determined.

primary_outcome.measure: Cmax of OCR-002 immediate-release tablets over the course of TID dosing for 5 days
primary_outcome.description: Cmax of OCR-002 immediate-release tablets over the course of TID dosing for 5 days will be determined.

primary_outcome.measure: Cmax of PAA, PAGN, and ornithine following 3 times a day (TID) OCR 002 oral tablet administration for 5 days in participants with cirrhosis
primary_outcome.description: Cmax of PAA, PAGN, and ornithine following 3 times a day (TID) OCR 002 oral tablet administration for 5 days in participants with cirrhosis will be determined.

primary_outcome.description: Ammonia-lowering (Tmax) effect of OCR-002 over the course of TID dosing for 5 days will be determined.

primary_outcome.measure: AUC of oral, immediate-release (IR) OCR 002 tablets
primary_outcome.description: AUC of oral, immediate-release (IR) OCR 002 tablets will be determined.

primary_outcome.measure: AUC of PAA, PAGN, and ornithine following 3 times a day (TID) OCR 002 oral tablet administration for 5 days in participants with cirrhosis
primary_outcome.description: AUC of PAA, PAGN, and ornithine following 3 times a day (TID) OCR 002 oral tablet will be determined.

primary_outcome.description: Degree of fluctuation (Day 5) of OCR-002 immediate-release tablets will be determined.

primary_outcome.description: T1/2 of OCR-002 immediate-release tablets will be determined.

primary_outcome.description: Drug elimination (Cmax) following discontinuation of OCR-002 oral tablets will be determined.

primary_outcome.measure: Urinary excretion profile of urea following TID administration of OCR-002 oral tablets of each treatment in participants with cirrhosis
primary_outcome.description: Urinary excretion profile of urea following TID administration of OCR-002 oral tablets of each treatment in participants with cirrhosis will be determined.

primary_outcome.description: Urinary excretion of PAGN following TID administration of OCR 002 oral tablets of each treatment in participants with cirrhosis will be determined.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adverse events of 5 g OCR-002 oral solution in participants with cirrhosis (Child-Pugh class A and C)
secondary_outcome.description: Adverse events data will be summarized.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adverse events of OCR-002 in participants with cirrhosis following multiple TID doses of OCR-002 tablets
secondary_outcome.description: Adverse events data will be summarized.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in sitting blood pressure of 5 g OCR-002 oral solution in participants with cirrhosis (Child-Pugh class A and C)
secondary_outcome.description: Sitting blood pressure will be measured after the participant has been in a sitting position for at least 3 minutes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in heart rate of 5 g OCR-002 oral solution in participants with cirrhosis (Child-Pugh class A and C)
secondary_outcome.description: Heart rate will be measured after the participant has been in a sitting position for at least 3 minutes.

secondary_outcome.description: Body temperature will be measured after the participant has been in a sitting position for at least 3 minutes.

secondary_outcome.description: Sitting blood pressure will be measured after the participant has been in a sitting position for at least 3 minutes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in heart rate of OCR-002 in participants with cirrhosis following multiple TID doses of OCR-002 tablets

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in body temperature of OCR-002 in participants with cirrhosis following multiple TID doses of OCR-002 tablets
secondary_outcome.description: Body temperature will be measured after the participant has been in a sitting position for at least 3 minutes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants with abnormal clinical chemistry values of 5 g OCR-002 oral solution in participants with cirrhosis (Child-Pugh class A and C)
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment-emergent abnormal laboratory tests are those in which the baseline value is normal (within the laboratory normal reference range) and post-baseline value is abnormal (i.e., meets Grade III or Grade IV toxicity criteria from the National Cancer Institute Common Terminology Criteria.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants with abnormal hematology values of 5 g OCR-002 oral solution in participants with cirrhosis (Child-Pugh class A and C)
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment-emergent abnormal laboratory tests are those in which the baseline value is normal (within the laboratory normal reference range) and post-baseline value is abnormal (i.e., meets Grade III or Grade IV toxicity criteria from the National Cancer Institute Common Terminology Criteria.

secondary_outcome.description: Treatment-emergent abnormal laboratory tests are those in which the baseline value is normal (within the laboratory normal reference range) and post-baseline value is abnormal (i.e., meets Grade III or Grade IV toxicity criteria from the National Cancer Institute Common Terminology Criteria.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants with abnormal urinalysis values of 5 g OCR-002 oral solution in participants with cirrhosis (Child-Pugh class A and C)
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment-emergent abnormal laboratory tests are those in which the baseline value is normal (within the laboratory normal reference range) and post-baseline value is abnormal (i.e., meets Grade III or Grade IV toxicity criteria from the National Cancer Institute Common Terminology Criteria.

secondary_outcome.description: Treatment-emergent abnormal laboratory tests are those in which the baseline value is normal (within the laboratory normal reference range) and post-baseline value is abnormal (i.e., meets Grade III or Grade IV toxicity criteria from the National Cancer Institute Common Terminology Criteria.

arm_group.description: • OCR-002 - Treatment A: A single 5 g oral dose of OCR-002 oral solution administered under fasting conditions
• OCR-002 - Treatment B: A single 5 g oral dose of OCR-002 oral solution administered under fed conditions
• OCR-002 - Treatment C: A single 5 g intravenous dose of OCR-002 solution infused over 1 hour under fasting conditions
• OCR-002 - Treatment D: A single 5 g oral dose of OCR-002 oral solution administered under fasting conditions following discontinuation of lactulose
• OCR-002 - Treatment E: 6 g OCR-002 per day (2 tablets TID for 6 g total daily dose)
• OCR-002 - Treatment F: 12 g OCR-002 per day (4 tablets TID for 12 g total daily dose)
• OCR-002 - Treatment G: 21 g OCR-002 per day (7 tablets TID for 21 g total daily dose)

intervention.description: Single 5 g oral dose of OCR-002 administered under fasting conditions
Single 5 g oral dose of OCR-002 administered under fed conditions
Single 5 g IV dose of OCR-002 administered under fasting conditions
Single 5 g oral dose of OCR-002 administered under fasting conditions following the discontinuation of lactulose
6 g OCR-002 per day (2 tablets TID for 6 g total daily dose)
12 g OCR-002 per day (4 tablets TID for 12 g total daily dose)
21 g OCR-002 per day (7 tablets TID for 21 g total daily dose)
